quotes: Horst Köhler (2004–2010)
Horst Köhler, born in 1943 in Skierbieszów, Poland
Horst Köhler was born in Skierbieszów, Poland, on 22 February 1943
He worked for the Economic Affairs Ministry in Bonn from 1976
In 1976, Köhler joined the Policy Principles Directorate-General of the Federal Ministry of Economics in Bonn
In 2000 he was made Managing Director of the IMF in Washington
During the war in 1944, the family fled from the advancing Soviet troops
In 1953, before the uprising on 17 June, the Köhlers managed to flee to the Federal Republic of Germany
finally finding a new home in the Swabian city of Ludwigsburg in 1957
Köhler sited his university entrance examination at Ludwigsburg's Mörike Grammar School in 1963
In 1969 he completed his studies at the University of Tübingen
In 1977, Köhler obtained his doctorate from the University of Tübingen
In 1981, he left Bonn for Kiel
When Stoltenberg became Federal Finance Minister with the change of government in 1982

Horst Köhler, born in 1943 in Skierbieszów, Poland
Horst Köhler was born in Skierbieszów, Poland, on 22 February 1943
ended up in Ludwigsburg after his family fled the advancing Soviet troops
finally finding a new home in the Swabian city of Ludwigsburg in 1957
He worked for the Economic Affairs Ministry in Bonn from 1976
In 1976, Köhler joined the Policy Principles Directorate-General of the Federal Ministry of Economics in Bonn
return to Bonn, where he joined the leading officials in the Finance Ministry
In 2000 he was made Managing Director of the IMF in Washington
the family fled from the advancing Soviet troops and settled in Markkleeberg-Zöbigker near Leipzig
He studied economic science in Tübingen and gained a doctorate
In 1981, he left Bonn for Kiel
